review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 30, 2023
name: No Names Please
title: Hours of Fun
text: The doodle board is a great, low tech, non-screen-time form of entertainment for my child.The picture cards give alot of ideas and are fun to try to duplicate on the board.The magnetic pen is actually attached by a string so it makes the board easy to keep together and use in places like the car without worrying about lost parts.The only change I wish for is to have a storage area/slot on the backside of the board for the picture cards.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 30, 2023
name: BenBTizMe
title: Simple and Fun
text: This is so simple and fun for my grandkids. I know the 4 and 8 year old will love playing with this. And adults are going to love that the tiny pieces are contained! Honestly, you can't ask for more than that with a toy like this.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 28, 2023
name: tony
title: Our grandkids love this.
text: Sensory toys are all the rage these days and this one did not disappoint. It’s a cute little play set and our grandkids argued over who gets to play with this one first.It seems to be put together well and it’s colorful.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 27, 2023

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 27, 2023
name: Tim & Samantha Ellis
title: Toddler loves it!
text: My toddler loves this magnetic doodle set! It’s easy for her to play with, and I love that it’s all self contained (no messy parts to get lost)! The acrylic front does easily get scratched by the magnetic pen which is kind of a bummer, but I don’t know how this problem would be avoided while still be safe for toddler usage since acrylic easily scratches naturally. Overall, very happy with this product!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 25, 2023
name: Nicole and Jeffrey Payne
title: Fun a toy!
text: Super fun toy for those little aspiring artists who love to draw! It’s a little bit of a different take on most magnetic drawing boards but is a nice change of pace! It is pretty easy to use and our kids enjoy playing with it a ton!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 24, 2023

title: Great fun for young children
text: My grandson loves this. He always plays with one when we go to the library and now he can play at home. The colors are bright. It is strong and sturdy for young children to play with.

It’s also great for children to use their mechanical and coordination skills.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 18, 2023
name: Billy P
title: Nice Toy
text: I always like toys which help with coordination, and thinking. This can be enjoyed by various ages from one year and up. All the pieces are contained, so there is no issue with chocking, or losing the parts.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 17, 2023
name: Avery
title: Screen free fun
text: So I got this for my young kids for car/restaurant, general screen-free entertainment. It works well- magnet is strong enough to hold the pieces, self-contained. I especially like all the design cards are two-sided and store in a little slot. My only complaint is that the pieces look like M&Ms… my little one literally calls them “the candy”. This seems sturdy enough, but I would be worried about my kids eating them if it cracks or breaks open.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 14, 2023
name: Nom Nom Nom
title: facilitate your kids creativity
text: My 5yrs old daughter love this toy. This toy comes with a bunch of flash cards with various art piece and my daughter and I challenge each other to duplicate the drawings. We time ourselves to see who is faster. This is a fun toy and is made for kids.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 14, 2023
name: Amazon Customer
title: Good quality
text: Purchased for 3 year old autistic grandson. It took him a few to get the hang of it but he enjoys playing with it. Does not make pics yet but finds it challenging and will stay focused for quite some time making straight lines

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 14, 2023
name: Kristan S
title: Portable creativity and easy to use
text: The magnet board is a good activity. The attached pen is easy to access and hold. The small magnets are colorful and easy to drag and drop. The recreate pictures are fun to make too. Love that it's portable and a nice travel or restraunt activity.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 12, 2023
name: THYM
title: 5 stars
text: The doodle board is well made and looks interesting. My daughter enjoys making her own patterns using the magnetic pen and the beads. There are 10 sheets with 20 patterns included in the package. Love the mess free magnetic doodle board concept. This board keeps my daughter occupied for hours. Love it!!!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 19, 2023
name: Howard G
title: Fun toy for different age groups
text: This toy works well. The magnet is a good shape and size for kids to operate and place the dots where they are supposed to go. It seems this was a good toy for younger kids 3-4 because they can make their own designs and for older kids 5-9 because they can recreate the designs on the cards. The only downside is that the magnet tool is not attached and can be easily lost.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 3, 2023
name: L Wang
title: Fun activity, few caveats
text: So for this you use a magnetic pen and you "draw" by placing the colored magnetic circles into holes. The whole thing is sealed so you don't have to worry about plastic M&M lookalike things flying everywhere. It's a fun activity once you get the hang of it. The hardest part of actually using it I think is when the dots are laying on top of each other and you're trying to get the bottom one. But the acrylic or clear plastic part flexes a little so you can press down. It comes with patterns or you can be creative and carve your own path..There are 2 issues that you should be aware of. The magnetic pen is not tethered to the rest of the toy so it can be lost. It's bright yellow but it's also not very wide. If your child is meticulous about putting stuff back together then odds are good it'll stay intact.The other is that the acrylic piece gets scratched up on use. Over time it'll get hazier and I'm not sure howmuch longer it can take toddler scrape-age and still be pleasant to look at it. It has been over a month for us though with occasional use and it looks mostly okay, but the scratches are noticeable. I'd say 8/10 condition.Overall, a fun activity that stays mostly together and the cleanup isn't painful at all. However, the scratches in the plastic screen and the fact that the magnetic pen is liable to get lost are a bit annoying. (strong fridge magnets will work though). So it gets 4 stars.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 17, 2023
name: Stacy
title: Son loved this
text: This toy has entertained my son for so long now. It was tricky at first, but he was able to figure out how to move the colored circles on his own using the pen. I could see his dexterity improving in only a matter of 15 minutes. He’s also been able to practice color sorting using this toy. I love that it’s mess free and while I think it would be great on a flight, the toy itself is quite large and not sure if I would end up having room for this.My one issue with this is that I wish the pen could somehow stay connected to the board. Even if it was as simple as having a hole and I could thread a piece of string, I would be happy. That’s another reason I’m not sure if I would bring this on a flight, because of the potential to lose the pen.Besides that, it’s a great toy!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 10, 2023
name: Kat
title: Great Drawing Board for Toddlers
text: My daughter loves this board! It is easy to use and allows for so much creativity without a big mess! I love that there is a space for the pencil and a slot to put the pattern cards in so the kids can see the pattern and copy it! I would 100% recommend this!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 10, 2023
name: Ekayem
title: Fun toy, all ages like it
text: What a fun toy!The last 2 days it has been a source of arguments between the grand kids.They are 2, 4 and 7 so it appeals to all ages.I enjoy messing around with it too.Sturdy, it has survived being stepped on.The cover does scratch from the magnet wand but that was expected.Worth buying!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 6, 2023
name: jihaekor
title: Fun little set for toddlers!
text: We bought this board for our 2-year-old son, and it is one of my favorites so far! While our son is not old enough to truly start to create shapes using this yet, he still found it fascinating that he could drag the magnetic beads around with the pen and started placing them around the board. It actually didn't take him as long as I thought it might to figure out the workings of the board - he was moving the beads around at will probably within the first minute. The magnet on the pen looks very strong, so even when our son was doing it, he didn't really have much of an issue holding on to them and moving them around.The board even comes with cards that have recommended patterns you can try. These will probably come in handy as he gets older, as he figures out how to follow along with them.The two minor complaints that I have with the board are: (1) I wish there was another pen included to allow two kids (or a kid and a parent) to work on this at the same time, especially given its decent size; and (2) I think the pen should have been tied to the board via some sort of a string; I am afraid it will be very easy to lose the pen as it detaches completely from the board. Especially given that both are things that you can see from the product pictures before buying, I didn't take any stars off for them.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 4, 2023
name: David
title: Great game
text: An excellent game that helps develop fine motor skills and patience. The pen is used as a magnet for the beads inside the box.The game is very safe.There are tabs with pictures to copy.Recommends

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 2, 2023
name: Sofie
title: Age range is too young
text: Pro: My parents have an also duplicate game to this one from 25 years ago, and my niece LOVES it. When I saw this I had to get it for her.The version my parents have allows the paper image to slide behind the screen so it operates like a paint-by-number game. She drags the appropriately colored chip to the spot on the board where it shows a dot on the image of that color you can see through the screen.Con: Too advanced for the ages shown.This is free form.It would require a child to comprehend for example a blue dot is 4 circles in, 5 circles up from the bottom, and place the dot there.Unless the child is advanced, I do not see this for younger than kindergarten. I tried it myself and was counting circles for the first few dots to get parts of the outline in the right spots before I started filling in the rest.Con: Lose Pen.While this was portrayed in the images, the pen is NOT attached to the board by a string, so I give it one time of being thrown in the toy bin for it to be lost amongst all the other toys.I'll need to buy and superglue a string to the board so it stays attached.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 1, 2023
name: Brianna Michelle Pullen
title: Fun for all!
text: Got this for my toddler he loves to shake it more than anything but my fiancé has found a strong liking to it so I would say for all ages! I wish the pen was attached to the board with a stretchy string it’s SUPER easy to lose

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 10, 2023
name: Victoria D
title: So fun
text: Love this! We stick it in our bag for restaurants! My 18 month old and 5 year old take turns with it and both really enjoy it. I love that the stylist is ATTACHED so I’m not hunting for it all the time. And the front cover makes it mess free. Total win for us!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 9, 2023
name: Hamish
title: Fantastic magnetic bead board
text: OK, so I recently tried a similar product and it was terrible. Luckily, this magnetic board doesn’t have any of those problems the other one did and works GREAT. My son is obsessed with this toy and loves to just drag the beads all over the board. He’s young and doesn’t really care about making pictures and just has a blast moving the beads from space to space.One big plus that sets this aside from the dozens of other magnetic boards on Amazon is the fact that this comes with a string that attaches the pen to the board. This is huge. My son lost the pen to the other board almost immediately and it was such a pain to find… only for him to lose it again within a day. The pen on this board is tethered to the unit, but has a long enough slack where you can still use it with full range of motion. It’s kind of annoying to have the string get in the way every once in a while, but I’d much rather deal with that than deal with a constantly lost pen.Overall, love this board. My family has a lot of fun with it; highly recommended.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 9, 2023
name: Pamela J. King
title: Easy to transport.Everything you need in one piece
text: Great to travel with.Great for all ages with pictures for the little ones to follow and easy to create your own pictures.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 6, 2023
name: abbylou322
title: Quiet and Creative
text: The first thing that I LOVE is that the magnetic "pen" is attached, I have purchased another style of this that don't have that and my largest concern is that the kids will lose the pen and make it un-usable. All 3 of my kids enjoy this toy and they range in age from 4-9. I think it is a great car/van/road trip activity as well because it is quiet and encourages creativity and has endless possibilities. I am excited for this to be used everyday in my home!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 3, 2023
name: Amazon Customer
title: Keeps my daughter busy and helps her count and make the design!
text: I like it help with motor, skills color matching, and design skills.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 3, 2023
name: StanfordBear
title: Nice Fun Board for Playtime
text: PROS+Larger than other competitors+Includes various design templates to inspire creations+Great for hand-eye coordination trainingCONS-The transparent plastic screen that keeps all the magnetic beads in place is somewhat thin. I worry that my youngest child will potentially break the screen and try to eat the M&M looking magnetic pieces.-The magnetic beads have a tendency to stick to the clear screen and only drop into place if you tap the screen.SUMMARYOverall, this has been a great purchase. My kids have really enjoyed the challenge of making the different suggested designs. In the process of doing so, this has helped improved both their spatial planning as well as motor coordination.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 3, 2023
name: OneCent
title: Pen is tethered, yay!
text: This one is really big. Over 12 inches on each side, it’s a full table of “drawing”, which is good for home activity, maybe too big for on the road activity. The pen is tethered to the tablet! I love that, because anything that could get lost will get lost around here and finally there’s one with the pen tied down. The rope on it is long enough to go anywhere on the tablet surface. The front plastic is thin, can break, and will scratch over time. Therefore, it should not be used with any kids or siblings around who may still be putting stuff into their mouths. This seems to be a consistent feature and problem with all of these types. My 4.8 yr old is having fun with it, so I think it’s fine to use with a little older kids and not too young of toddlers.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 2, 2023
name: EG
title: Fun for toddlers to early primary grades
text: Easy to use. The children enjoy playing with the magnets and making pictures with the dots. A good gift or feature for a classroom.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 23, 2023
name: daniela collins
title: Great Creative Play Item
text: I love these magnetic boards, because they not only develop eye hand coordination, but also stir creativity. Kids can either use the pattern cards or develop their own designs. The students can also make letters, numbers and words. Very well made and sturdy, and should last for a while, even in a busy classroom.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 23, 2023
name: daniela collins
title: Great Classroom Toy
text: I love these magnetic boards, because they not only develop eye hand coordination, but also stir creativity. Kids can either use the pattern cards or develop their own designs. The students can also make letters, numbers and words. Very well made and sturdy, and should last for a while, even in a busy classroom.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 23, 2023
name: JW
title: Sturdy, a cool fine motor skill toy
text: I think this is a fun toy. Hours of entertainment for kids. Watch them closely while playing however - the pieces look like candy and can be dangerous if swallowed as they are magnets. Warning signs are on the box about this as well. Hold the pen straight up and down to 'pick up' each piece and drop it where you want it. The pen has a string which is nice not to lose it. That's how all of them should come! The only thing is that it doesn't come with hooks or a pocket of some kind on the back to hold all the cards in there. It's awkward to have to hold the cards. That's something I'll have to figure out so we don't lose them all or have to worry about forgetting them. Bummer that's a bit of a missed design aspect.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 22, 2023
name: GreatDane
title: BUY!
text: Real review here. As a middle school counselor, my students enjoyed this magpad! Great buy for all ages, keeps the students engaged or using it as a coping mechanism.

text: I had this while I was growing up and loved it! Something about all the colors and the shapes of it all. I was really excited and surprised when this came up in my feed on the Home Screen, I’d totally forgotten about it and didn’t even think they still made it. I’m excited for my kids to play with it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 10, 2023

title: Wrapped in a box vs the envelope.I hope it’s not broke.
text: Ordered for Easter presents for the grandchildren.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 7, 2023
name: Hody
title: Poor service and Poor quality
text: This product did not meet my expectations in terms of quality.Firstly, as the slightest impact or bump would cause the plastic to crack or break.In addition, the magnetic pen was of poor quality. The pen was difficult to control and did not work well with the board's drawing surface.Finally, and most importantly, I am concerned about the safety of this product.The thin plastic casing and weak magnetic components make it a hazard for children, as it can easily break and expose sharp edges or small pieces.Overall, I do not recommend this magnetic drawing board to anyone, as it is of low quality, poor durability, and a safety hazard. I would suggest looking for alternative products that are sturdier, safer, and more reliable.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 27, 2023
name: s12ms
title: Look like M&M toddler might eat
text: I purchased for a individual with dementia. I left the clear plastic on and just took out magnet pen and taped over that opening. He enjoys moving them around keeps busy lining them up. For safety I would recommend leaving plastic film on.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 24, 2023

title: My great-grandkids fight over this.
text: They all love it.
